subject: Re: [junit] junit installatation
msgSnippet: ... C: * and D: * do nothing on your classpath. I recommend you find an online tutorial that describes how class paths work in Java. ... The graphical test
messageBody:
Anh wrote:
> this my classpath setup
> C:\junit3.8.1;C:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;C:\*;D:\*;

C:\* and D:\* do nothing on your classpath.

I recommend you find an online tutorial that describes how class paths
work in Java.

> __________________SWINGUI_______________
> command to execute:
>
> C:\Documents and Settings\ANH\Desktop\Hw3\build>java
> junit.swingui.TestRunner SortTestCase
>
> (class not found:Sorttestcase)//at the bottom of the
> GUI

The graphical test runner, to my knowledge, does not work with tests in
the default package. Put your SortTestCase into a named package (like
com.mycompany.test) and it should work.

Again, I recommend you find an online tutorial that describes how
packages work in Java.

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
